item.description: Contents Bahrain Lebanon Bahrain Al-Ayyam Terrorists may take advantage of the world’s preoccupation with the Corona pandemic… the British ambassador for “Al-Ayyam” In an interview with Al-Ayyam, the British ambassador to Bahrain said that the response of the Bahraini health system to the spread of COVID-19 was exemplary and rapid, pointing to the impressive success of the Bahraini responses especially since it only took two months.

Contents Egypt Saudi Qatar Jordan Syria Egypt Ahram One hand protects from the pandemic and the other builds the desert Throughout Egyptian history, Sinai has never received this volume of development projects… The roads, tunnels, and bridges tht are being built will change life across all of Egypt and not just Sinai… I have seen the many giant national projects, which were accomplished by the people of Egypt under the leadership of President Abdel Fattah El-Sisi during the past years, and… I did not believe that all of these projects were completed in this record time

Contents Al-Araby Al-Jadeed Al-Jazeera Al-Arabiya Sky News Arabia Al-Sharq Al-Awsat Al-Araby Al-Jadeed Corona Egypt: Doubts about the efficiency of the return-to-work plans The Egyptian government continues to rush towards a full return to service and financial activities after the end of the month of Ramadan, despite the worsening situation of the new Corona epidemic, the steady increase in the number of daily casualties… and the failure of the state to conduct random tests even in areas that witnessed high infection rates.

item.title: Data
item.description: We combined data from UNHCR’s Syrian refugees per locality in Lebanon (as defined by UNHCR, from December 2018) with data on Lebanese voters per locality (using the 2018 elections). The data can be accessed here.

item.title: Research
item.description: Publications Do Donor Motives Matter? Investigating Perceptions of Foreign Aid in the conflict in Donbas Forthcoming at International Studies Quarterly. With Rachel Myrick and Isaac Webb. How do the perceived motives of donor states shape recipient attitudes towards foreign aid in a conflict zone? We identify two frames that characterize the motives of foreign powers involved in an ongoing civil conflict in the Donbas region of eastern Ukraine. These frames portray foreign actors as either providing aid to alleviate suffering during conflict (humanitarian frame) or to increase their power and influence in the recipient country (political influence frame).

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I have worked as teaching assistant for courses in comparative politics, international relations, and Middle East politics. These courses include: War and Peace in American Foreign Policy (Kenneth Schultz, Spring 2018) Middle Eastern Politics (Lisa Blaydes, Fall 2017) Islam, Iran, and the West (Abbas Milani, Spring 2017) U.S. Relations with Iran (Abbas Milani, Fall 2016)
